resources.string: Password required to decrypt device each time you turn it on.

"You can encrypt accounts, settings, downloaded applications, and their data, media, and other files. Once you encrypt your device, a password will be required to decrypt it each time you power it on.
Encryption takes an hour or more. Start with a charged battery and keep device plugged in until encryption is completed. Interrupting may cause you to lose some or all data."
Disabled by administrator, encryption policy, or credential storage.
View or disable device administrators.
To see devices, turn on Bluetooth.
Tap the button at the top of the screen to add devices to the allowed device list.
Mobile Hotspot consumes more battery. Connect the device to an outlet to extend battery life.
You can create an allowed device list and set the connection mode for allowed devices.
Set up peer-to-peer connectivity.
Play tones when keypad is pressed.
Play tones when keypad is pressed.
Play sound when making screen selection.
Play sound when making screen selection.
Play sounds when locking and unlocking screen.
Play sounds when locking and unlocking screen.
Play sounds when inserting and removing device from dock.
Show status of battery, network, and other information.
Reset all settings and delete all data on device.
All data will be erased from USB storage, including your Google account, system and application data, settings, and downloaded applications.
Allow installation of non-Market apps.
No words in user dictionary. Add a word by tapping the add (+) button.
Debugging mode launches when USB is connected.
Allow mock locations.
Allow mock locations.
Press and hold delay
Speed at which the text is spoken.
Play short demonstration of speech synthesis.
Set up and manage Virtual Private Networks (VPNs).
Install certificates from storage.
Remove all certificates.
Display trusted CA certificates.
Set a screen unlock pattern, PIN, or password before you using credential storage.
Back up app data, Wi-Fi passwords, and other settings to Google servers.
When reinstalling an application, backed up settings and data will be restored.
Full desktop backups are not currently protected.
No device administrators available.
Make screen flash when apps perform long operations on main thread.
Screen overlay showing current touch data.
Show visual feedback for touch interactions.
Make areas of screen flash when they update.
Screen overlay showing current CPU usage.
Use 2D hardware acceleration in applications.
Destroy every activity as soon as the user leaves it.
Show app not responding dialogue for background apps.
No apps used data during this time.
Incoming calls and new notifications will be read out automatically.
Use external speakers when device is docked.
Adjust the delay before the Touch key light automatically turns off.
Show clock on lock screen.
Show help text on lock screen.
Set an unlock password of at least 6 characters, containing at least 1 number.

This option limits the maximum CPU performance and helps to conserve battery life. It will not effect normal usage, like browsing and video playback, if you do not use resource-intensive apps and games.
This option reduces the screen frame rate and lowers the brightness. It helps to extend battery life when the screen is turned on.
Reverses the colors of screen.
Press and hold the power key to use the accessibility shortcut under device options.
Provides mono audio for listening with one earphone.
Press and hold at two points, then tilt device back and forth to zoom in or out of screen
Press and hold the screen while rotating the device to open Camera
Holding the device straight, press and hold the screen and rotate the device to open Camera
Show dual clock on lock screen when roaming.
Shows battery percentage on indicator.
LED lights up when device is connected to charger. LED will only light up when screen is off.
LED lights up when you have missed calls, messages, or application events. LED will only light up when screen is off.
Show desk home screen when device is docked.
E911 Location cannot be turned off on any mobile cellular phone.
Use location services provided by Verizon Wireless.
Use location services based on Standalone GPS.
Use location services provided by Google.
Set shortcuts on lock screen.
Set shortcuts on lock screen.
Drag and drop to delete or change order.
Use voice commands to control device.
You can answer or reject calls with the voice commands %1$s and %2$s. Speaker will turn on when you answer a call using voice command.
You can stop or snooze alarms with the voice commands %1$s and %2$s.
You can take pictures with voice commands like %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, and %4$s.
You can control the music player with the voice commands %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s, %5$s, and %6$s.
When launching high data usage applications (Wi-Fi ON), scan for nearby Wi-Fi networks and notify me when available.
When launching high data usage applications, connect to known Wi-Fi networks when Wi-Fi is off.
Turn off all sounds including receiver voice.
LED lights up when battery level is low. LED will only light up when screen is off.
When explore by touch is enabled, characters entered in password fields are read out by the device.
Unlock using wake-up command when swipe or motion lock enabled.
Connecting earphones will enable audio applications in quick panel.
